text:
You know that Newton’s law of gravity doesn’t apply to Rajinikanth, right? And that Rohit Shetty is known for his logic-defying stunts in his movies. Cars fly in order to impress women, Salman Khan travels faster than a train, bullet proof jackets are passe when you can dodge bullets by ducking – we have all seen that in films, haven’t we? And we seldom raised any questions.
Screengrab
Now that Rajinikanth and Akshay Kumar starrer 2.0 is releasing, India’s telecom companies are protesting against the movie. Wondering why? If you have watched the trailer of the movie, you would know that it shows telephones turning against their users in a post-apocalyptic world. If you haven’t seen the trailer, watch the video below to know more.
“Every person who owns a cellphone is a murderer,” growls the villain in the movie.
So, offended at this, the Cellular Operators Association of India (COAI) have written a letter to the country’s censor board and government.

In the letter, they say that the movie is promoting “obscurantist and anti-scientific attitudes against mobile phones, towers and mobile services."
COAI has also accused the filmmakers of “falsely depicting mobile phones and mobile towers as harmful to living creatures and the environment including birds and human beings.”
Twitter
Meanwhile, Rajinikanth and Akshay Kumar starrer 2.0 has released on Nov 29. It has opened well at the box office. About 1.2 million tickets have already been sold out and the movie minted Rs 355 crore through sales.
title: Telecom Operators Demand Ban On Rajinikanth’s 2.0 Because Of ‘Anti-Scientific Attitude’ In Film
